title: How to Add a Stop During a Ride on Uber

steps.title: Open up the trip in progress inside your Uber app.
steps.content: Open up the trip in progress inside your Uber app. Tap the black icon with the word "Uber" on it. This will open up Uber into the ride in progress.

steps.title: Tap the bar at the bottom of your screen to pull that section open.
steps.content: Tap the bar at the bottom of your screen to pull that section open.

steps.title: Look below the box listing the driver details for another box containing several other options.
steps.content: Look below the box listing the driver details for another box containing several other options. This area lists the current destination, as well as the current price, sharing, and cancellation options. If you see "Save this destination" or the driver information, you're looking too far down the screen.

steps.title: Tap the "Add or Change" button to the right of the current destination.
steps.content: Tap the "Add or Change" button to the right of the current destination.

steps.title: Tap the + button to the right of the initial destination.
steps.content: Tap the + button to the right of the initial destination.

steps.title: Agree to keep the stop to a wait time of about three minutes or less.
steps.content: Agree to keep the stop to a wait time of about three minutes or less. Read the informational area at the bottom of the screen, then tap the "Done" button at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Fill out the second stop, if you'd like to make a second stop.
steps.content: Fill out the second stop, if you'd like to make a second stop. Tap the line that initially says "Add a stop" and search for the second destination. Type your second stop into the box using either the place's name and city then tap the matching item in the search list.

steps.title: Repeat the process adding other stops (if necessary) beginning with tapping the + sign to the right of the third line (second stop).
steps.content: Repeat the process adding other stops (if necessary) beginning with tapping the + sign to the right of the third line (second stop). You can only make three stops in an Uber ride. To make more stops, allow the driver to finish the ride. Then begin a new request with the additional stops.

steps.title: Confirm that you'd like to update the trip.
steps.content: Confirm that you'd like to update the trip. Once you confirm the change, the fares and fees may change. Tap the "Update" button.

steps.title: Verify the changes.
steps.content: Verify the changes. On the screen, you'll see a box below the map that shows you the stops progression. The lighter-colored top line is your pickup location, and the darker-colored bottom lines contain your stops in the order you were expecting to see presented to your driver. If you still need to change them, you can still make the changes - such as to re-organize the stops in a more logical order if necessary.
